result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob W. Feigl

defendant.name: Feigl, Jacob W.
defendant.address: E7168 Irish Valley Rd, Plain, WI 53577

records.addlTxt:
1:42 PM Defendant Jacob W. Feigl not in court.  Attorney Janae F. Hochmuth in court for Jacob W. Feigl.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Hochmuth advises there is a global offer and anticipates matter resolving.  Requests a plea and sentencing.  No objection from State.  Matter reset.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
DE to have no violent/abusive contact with S.F.  Not to reside w/S.F.  If he has any in person contact w/S.F., another adult must be present.

2:27 PM Defendant Jacob W. Feigl in court.  Attorney Janae F. Hochmuth in court for Jacob W. Feigl.  Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Victim S.F. also appears in person.  Court has her come forward and take a seat in the witness stand.  S.F. states she wants the no contact provision lifted entirely.  State responds that they are opposed to modification.  Atty Hochmuth and DE do no object to the modification.  Court asks questions of S.F.  Atty Hochmuth has no questions.  State asks questions of S.F.  S.F. retakes her seat in the back.  State makes argument.  Atty Hochmuth makes argument.  Court modifies the bond to:  DE to have no violent/abusive contact with S.F.  Not to reside w/S.F.  If he has any in person contact w/S.F., another adult must be present.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob W. Feigl in court.  Attorney Janae F. Hochmuth in court for Jacob W. Feigl.  Atty Hochmuth provides Court with an authorization.  Court approves the authorization.  Atty Hochmuth advises no offer has been received yet and requests a new return date.  State requests a pre-trial and return date.  Matter reset.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Return date scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No contact w/S.K.F.; May retrieve your belongings if accompanied by a law enforcement officer upon prior notice, one time.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob W. Feigl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Janae F. Hochmuth appeared by video for Jacob W. Feigl. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Atty Hochmuth advises DE's circumstances have changed and does not qualify for PD representation.   File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  State recommends $250 cash bond.  Atty Hochmuth requests a signature bond or no more than $100 cash and requests no violent or abusive contact.  $150.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with S.K.F.  DE may return one time, upon prior notice and with LE to retrieve any personal belongings.
Return date scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
